content:
Q: When is the Young and/or Inexperienced Driver Excess applicable?
A: The Young and/or Inexperienced Driver Excess is applicable in addition to the Own Damage Excess amount specified in the Schedule if the Insured Vehicle is driven by or under the control of any person (other than the Policyholder) who at the time of loss or damage to the Insured Vehicle is below twenty-seven (27) years of age and/or has held a valid driving license for less than two (2) years.
questions: What is the Young and/or Inexperienced Driver Excess?
Under what conditions is the Young and/or Inexperienced Driver Excess applied?
Does the age of the driver affect the application of the Young and/or Inexperienced Driver Excess?
How does the duration for which a driver has held a license impact the Young and/or Inexperienced Driver Excess?
Is the Young and/or Inexperienced Driver Excess applicable if the policyholder is driving?
What additional excess is applied if a young or inexperienced person drives the insured vehicle?
At what age is a driver considered young for the Young and/or Inexperienced Driver Excess?
What is the maximum age for a driver to be considered inexperienced under the Young and/or Inexperienced Driver Excess?
How long must a driver have held a license to avoid the Young and/or Inexperienced Driver Excess?
Is the Young and/or Inexperienced Driver Excess independent of the Own Damage Excess?
